title.narrative: OPT 1. 4. QUALITY EARLY LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES

description.narrative: 1.4. Education institutions in selected departments and municipalities provide quality early learning opportunities to children under five years in at least two of the four departments receiving UNICEF support, which contributes to Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Early Childhood Development, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children between 0 and 5 have access to Integrated Early Childhood Development (IECD) services to guarantee that they survive and thrive, including in emergency situations.

participating-org.narrative: ESCUELA DE GESTION PUBLICA PLURINACIONAL EGPP
INSTITUTO PLURINACIONAL DE ESTUDIO DE LENGUAS Y CULTURAS IPELC

sector.narrative: ECD – Parenting support (including gender responsive parenting) to promote responsive care and early stimulation

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/401 OCM 1. EVERY CHILD SURVIVES AND THRIVES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.4. Education institutions in selected departments and municipalities provide quality early learning opportunities to childrenunder five years in at least two of the four departments receiving UNICEF support

description.narrative: In total, 27,141 children under five years old (15.977 girls, 11,164 boys) benefited from stronger early childhood development services, care and education in El Alto and Independencia municipalities. UNICEF supported training, orientation, materials and strategy development to apply quality standards in care.Furthermore, 75,084 children (39,640 girls, 35,444 boys) benefited from strategies to improve development monitoring, promote loving and sensitive care, teach indigenous languages and enhance early education. To expand interventions from a comprehensive intersectoral perspective, UNICEF developed processes to train and strengthen technical teams in health, education and protection sectors at national level, enhancing capacities of 680 public servants. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2021
